meanings.sent1: The new law legitimized the use of electric scooters on the sidewalks.
meanings.sent2: The court legitimized the contract by stamping it with an official seal.
meanings.sent3: The magician legitimized his disappearing act by showing the audience how it was done.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work legitimized her position as a leader in the company.
meanings.sent5: The certificate legitimized his claim to be an expert in the field.

meanings.definition: To give official approval or recognition to
meanings.sent1: The committee legitimized the decision by unanimous vote.
meanings.sent2: The government legitimized the new currency by issuing a formal statement.
meanings.sent3: The cat legitimized its ownership of the house by leaving a dead mouse on the doorstep.
meanings.sent4: The artist legitimized her talent by winning multiple awards.
meanings.sent5: The badge legitimized his authority as a security guard.

meanings.definition: To establish as valid or genuine
meanings.sent1: The DNA test legitimized his claim to the inheritance.
meanings.sent2: The signature legitimized the document as an official agreement.
meanings.sent3: The dog legitimized its status as a family member by sleeping on the bed.
meanings.sent4: The rare artifact legitimized the museum's reputation as a collector of valuable items.
meanings.sent5: The expert's analysis legitimized the theory as scientifically sound.
